item.title: R Basics 1

This is the first of 2 sets of exercises introducing you to the R programming language1 that we will use throughout the workshop. ğŸ“ Lesson Preview Set up R and RStudio The R console Install packages Objects and assignment Types (character, numeric, vector, data frame, list) Component selection Workspace and history ğŸ Getting Started with R and RStudio To complete the exercises in this workshop, you will need to access RStudio.

item.title: R Basics 2
item.description: ğŸ“ Lesson Preview Functions Control Flow if statements for loops apply() Advanced: Parallel computation Functions If objects are the nouns of the R language, functions are the verbs. They do things to objects. Letâ€™s use the mean function as an example. This function takes the mean of a numeric vector object. Remember our numeric_vector object from Lesson 1:
